s.text: On the heels of yesterday's studies from two think tanks suggesting that the income gap between rich and poor continues to grow, the LAT fronts and the Wall Street Journal front-indexes similar word today from the Federal Reserve.
And he mentions a raft of dead Southern idealists who he thinks might well have voted to keep the Capitol flag in place, but it's significant that he doesn't mention any living ones.
The LAT high up says that yesterday's failure "measurably increases the odds" that Clinton will choose not to go ahead with a national missile shield.

Some of the more striking findings: Although from 1995 to 1998 the median family net worth rose from $60,900 to $71,600, the median family with a main breadwinner younger than 35 saw its net worth shrink by nearly 30 percent; during that same time span, median family debt rose from $23,000 to $33,300; and the percentage of families that own stock went from 31.
